result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex Pantoja was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2017

CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program or the Substance Abuse Program after serving 10 months of this sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- DOC's must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possesion of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for districution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
- Maintain full time employment.
- Court ordered defendant to comply with all child Support Court orders.
- Referral for Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

supervisions.notes:
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the court advised defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the defendant that under Wisconsin Statue 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The defenant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to ES, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the defendant being returned to prison.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex Pantoja

Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (920) 426-5601, and mailed to:  Drug Abuse Correctional Center, Attn:  Stephanie, PO Box 36, Winnebago, WI  54985-0036

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP, signed and filed.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 35, Judge Rosa.  jm

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alex Pantoja in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Alex Pantoja in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program after serving 10 months of this sentence. 

- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance shall be due no later than 12-31-2017; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Defendant is not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $200.00 at one time.
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
- Defendant my not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Referral for Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. 
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
 
Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letters on behalf of defendant with attached cover letter dated 12-15-2015 received and filed. tk
Letter from defendant dated 11-15-2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Alex Pantoja in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Alex Pantoja in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
 
AS TO COUNT 1 :

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, any victims, and the defendant. Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 3 business days in advance of the sentencing. 

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on 12-16-2015 at 1:30 pm , branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letter on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Attorney Pecora is unable to attend today's proceeding due to a medical emergency.Case was set for projected plea hearing.  Case is adjourned for projected plea and sentencing on 11-010-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons presented to the Court case adjourned for projected plea hearing on 09-28-2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.

Attorney Mark A Pecora in court, defendant Alex Pantoja not in court, in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed, and requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Substitution filed.  Case is now assigned to Judge Stark, branch 17, in room 310 of the safety building.  Clerk contacted Judge Stark's court for next court date.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 8/11/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  aw

Defendant Alex Pantoja in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Alex Pantoja in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reduce Bail

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Alex Pantoja in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Alex Pantoja in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
